title: API Reference
description: The following sections outlines the API of discord_cli.py.

properties.name: discord_cli.__version__
properties.description: A string representation of the version. This is based off PEP 440.

classes.name: Command_System
classes.description: The command system is a class which is used to generate and execute a set of commands.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the command system. The name should only contain alphabetic characters and underscores.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the command system. Usually explaining the perpose of the commands it contains.

properties.name: commands
properties.description: A list of the commands at the first level of the command system.

properties.name: command_count
properties.description: The amount of commands at the first level of the command system.

methods.name: command
methods.description: Adds a command to the first level of the command system and returns it.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the command. The name should only contain alphabetic characters and underscores.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the command

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The function executed when the command is called.

returns.description: The command added to the command system.

methods.name: tree_string
methods.description: Gets a string representation of the whole command system tree. It is reccomended that this method is only used for debugging.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: When true, shows the arguments, options, tags and permissions of the commands.

returns.description: The string representation of the command system.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The discord client for the bot application.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The discord message which envoked the command.

parameters.name: command_string
parameters.description: The command string to parse and execute.

parameters.name: *argv
parameters.description: Any extra arguments which you wish to be passed to the command function.

parameters.name: **kwargs
parameters.description: Any extra keyword arguments which you wish to be passed to the command function.

returns.description: The value returned by the command function. If the execution failed, the return of the execution error callback is returned instead.

methods.name: usage_message
methods.description: Gets a string representation of the command, it's usage and it's sub commands.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The discord client for the bot application.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The discord message which envoked the command.

parameters.name: command_string
parameters.description: The command string which identifies the command to get the usage message for.

returns.description: The string representation of the usage message.

methods.name: set_execution_error_callback
methods.description: Sets which function is to be called when there is an error when parsing a command.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function to be called upon error.

classes.name: Command
classes.description: A command object represents a single command. It contains the tools to assign arguments, options, tags and permissions to a command. A command object should not be initialized manually.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the command. The name should only contain alphabetic characters and underscores.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the command.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The command which this command is a sub command of.

parameters.name: command_string
parameters.description: The full command string required to identify the command uniquely.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The function to be executed when the command is called.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: The command which this command is a sub command of. Can be None

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description of the command. Can be None.

properties.name: command_string
properties.description: The full command string required to identify the command uniquely. Can be None.

properties.name: function
properties.description: The function that is executed when the command is called. Can be None.

properties.name: argument
properties.description: The argument builder used to add arguments to the command.

properties.name: option
properties.description: The option builder used to add options to the command.

methods.name: tag
methods.description: Adds a tag to the command.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the tag. Used to identify the tags value within the command function.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the tag. Describes what the tag is used for and what it does.

parameters.name: letter
parameters.description: The letter which identifies the tag. If not provided, the first letter of the name is used. Must contain a single letter.

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The word which identifies the tag. Must contain alphabetic characters only.

methods.name: permission
methods.description: Adds a permission to the command

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: The permission to add to the command. All permissions are seperate and a user only has to satisfy one of them to call a command successfully.

methods.name: get_command
methods.description: Gets a command specified by identifiers in argv and returns the command and the elements in argv which are parameters. Avoid calling this method manually.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The discord client for the bot application.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The discord message which envoked the command.

parameters.name: *argv
parameters.description: The seperated elements of a command string.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Executes the command's function. Avoid calling this method manually.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The discord client for the bot application.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The discord message which envoked the command.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: A list containing the seperated parameter input strings.

parameters.name: *argv
parameters.description: Any extra arguments which you wish to be passed to the command function.

parameters.name: **kwargs
parameters.description: Any extra keyword arguments which you wish to be passed to the command function.

methods.name: command
methods.description: Adds a sub command to the command and returns it.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the command. The name should only contain alphabetic characters and underscores.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the command

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The function executed when the command is called.

returns.description: The sub command added to the command.

methods.name: tree_string
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the command and all sub commands below it in the command system tree. Avoid using this method manually.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: When true, shows the arguments, options, tags and permission of the commands.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: A string that is displayed before each line of the result.

parameters.name: include_name
parameters.description: Whether to show the name of the first command.

returns.description: The string representation of the command tree from this command.

methods.name: usage_message
methods.description: Returns a usage message for the command.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The discord client for the bot application.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The discord message which envoked the command.

returns.description: The usage message for the command.
